main event: Multiple UFO sightings in Spokane, Washington on 21 June 1947, including one large, silvery, and slow-moving object and a series of flashes or discs seen near a passing plane.
interesting points: The sighting involved multiple observers, with the objects being described as quite large, shiny, and silvery.
The objects were seen at an altitude of 7,000 to 12,000 feet and were observed to move against prevailing winds.
Some of the observed flashes or discs appeared to be as high or higher than the passing plane, indicating their significant size and altitude.
Despite the possibility of the objects being balloons or ordinary aircraft, there were a number of incidents with no evident explanation.
Evaluation by Dr. Hynek suggests a range of sightings with varying probabilities of being astronomical, non-astronomical, or lacking a clear explanation.
sighted object: large, silvery, slow-moving object and a series of flashes or discs
